creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: male figure swooning against a tree, looking dramatically to his L at a grotesque, decaying figure with skull-like face, and long greasy hair who pulls at his arm; hour glass at figure's feet
inscription:
Signature

in graphite on verso: C 21283 | DTMABKH | B51 | Holl 110
provenance: [P. & D. Colnaghi, London (inv. no. on verso).] [David Tunick, New York; sold to Andrus]; John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Death and the Foot Soldier
